title: Brewers sign Shouse to one-year deal
subtitle: Shouse signs one-year contract
body: The Milwaukee Brewers signed left-handed reliever Brian Shouse to a one-year, $2 million contract on Wednesday, thus avoiding arbitration.  Shouse was 1-1 with a 3.02 ERA in a career-high 73 games last season, his second in Milwaukee.  The Brewers have four players remaining who are arbitration-eligible. They include pitchers Dave Bush, Chris Capuano and Claudio Vargas and shortstop J.J. Hardy. Carrie Muskat is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Carrie Muskat
